instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
HI.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that once in a while shows a picture, but mostly doesn't. I'm suspecting the GPU, as I had before the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> and after disabling the GPU all works fine. Is there a way to disable the GPU on this board model, please? 

Thanks :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Did you test in safe mode?
Starting in diagnostic mode pops up any error?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message: No, I haven't tested it, at this point, it doesn't wasn't to show a picture at all. A couple of times it showed and it stopped, just powers on fans spinning
